exceptions.exn: In environment V, P, E : Set σ : P -> nat φ : V -> nat ν : E -> nat p : dio_polynomial V P Unable to unify "(fix dp_eval (φ : V -> nat) (ν : P -> nat) (p : dio_polynomial V P) {struct p} : nat := match p with | dp_nat n => n | dp_var v => φ v | dp_par i => ν i | dp_add p0 q => dp_eval φ ν p0 + dp_eval φ ν q | dp_mul p0 q => dp_eval φ ν p0 * dp_eval φ ν q end) φ σ p" with "(fix dp_eval (φ : V -> nat) (ν : E -> nat) (p : dio_polynomial V E) {struct p} : nat := match p with | dp_nat n => n | dp_var v => φ v | dp_par i => ν i | dp_add p0 q => dp_eval φ ν p0 + dp_eval φ ν q | dp_mul p0 q => dp_eval φ ν p0 * dp_eval φ ν q end) φ ν ((fix dp_inst_par (p : dio_polynomial V P) : dio_polynomial V E := match p with | dp_nat c => dp_nat c | dp_var v => dp_var v | dp_par p0 => dp_nat (σ p0) | dp_comp o p0 q => dp_comp o (dp_inst_par p0) (dp_inst_par q) end) p)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
E: Set
P: Set
V: Set
σ: P -> nat
φ: V -> nat
ν: E -> nat
p: dio_polynomial V P

Goal:
dp_eval φ ν (dp_inst_par p) = dp_eval φ σ p
